drinkName.name: Opening Act
drinkName.about: Start your next meal with this gingery aperitif.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the tonic to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Fill with tonic and garnish with fresh mint.

drinkName.name: Chocolate Cheer
drinkName.about: Cheerleaders would be a lot more entertaining if they practiced this one more often.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Rusty Compass
drinkName.about: It won’t help you navigate, but it’s delicious.

ingredients.ingredient: Compass Box The Peat Monster malt scotch

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Chopin Mistletoe Martini
drinkName.about: This creamy and minty concoction might just be better than a kiss.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a candy cane.

drinkName.name: Banks Milk Punch
drinkName.about: Rum, cognac and just a dash of vanilla flavor this rich favorite.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (two parts clover honey, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into two chilled punch cups.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: The Dove
drinkName.about: Try this fresh spin on the Paloma.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a Champagne flute.
Top with Champagne.

drinkName.name: Brandy Alexander
drinkName.about: With cream, crème de cacao and brandy, classic is a creamy, indulgent delight. With many details of its origin unknown, the Brandy Alexander became popular in the early 20th century. Try this cocktail as a decadent after-dinner sipper.

ingredients.ingredient:
Cognac
Try it with Martell VS

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Antiguo Refresco
drinkName.about: A refreshing Margarita with a cucumber twist.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the cucumber and lime wedges.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a cucumber slice and lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Zacapa Perfect Manhattan
drinkName.about: Rum and honey syrup make an unusual but delicious version of the classic.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (one part honey, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Winter Cup
drinkName.about: A fruity concoction to remind you of warmer times.

ingredients.ingredient: Montecristo Spiced Blend Rum (or other spiced rum)

mix.how: In a shaker, gently muddle the strawberry, lime, lemon, orange and mint (do not break up the mint).
Add the spiced rum and St-Germain, and fill with ice.
Shake lightly and pour (unstrained) into an Old Fashioned glass.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Stoli Razpiroska
drinkName.about: This fizzy, fruity refresher has just four ingredients.

mix.how: In a rocks or Collins glass, muddle the raspberries and simple syrup.
Add the vodka and fill with ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with additional raspberries.

drinkName.name: Harvest Highball
drinkName.about: This easy cocktail is a good reason to keep a bottle of ginger beer on hand.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the ginger beer and garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Ginger Sour
drinkName.about: A tasty mix of ginger vodka, lemon juice and maple syrup.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: The Jalisco Jasmine
drinkName.about: This Mexican flower has bite.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Kingston Colada
drinkName.about: Get transported to Jamaica with this coconut and pineapple concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice.
Stir, and garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Apple Irish Coffee
drinkName.about: You won’t find this caffeinated drink at Starbucks.

mix.how: Fill a rocks glass with ice and add all the ingredients.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Teatime Toddy
drinkName.about: This classic hot cocktail goes tropical with a slug of spiced rum.

mix.how: Add the rum, lemon juice and syrup to a small mug.
Add the hot tea and bitters.
Stir, and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Dubonnet Cosmopolitan
drinkName.about: A grown up Cosmo with the refined taste of Dubonnet.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime twist.

drinkName.name: Pumpkin Nog
drinkName.about: Tony Abou-Ganim’s tasty pumpkin and cinnamon cocktail is the perfect drink for a fall party.

mix.how: Separate the eggs and refrigerate the whites.
In a mixing bowl, beat the yolks until creamy.
Gradually add in .25 lb sugar, beating at high speed until thick.
Stir in the rum, milk, vanilla, cinnamon and pumpkin, and chill for at least two hours.
Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form.
Add the remaining .25 lb sugar, beating to stiff peaks.
Fold the chilled rum mixture into the egg whites.
Serve in Martini glasses garnished with freshly grated nutmeg and a dollop of whipped cream.

drinkName.name: Pegu Club
drinkName.about: This classic cocktail was invented in a British social club in Burma.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Pear Tree Martini
drinkName.about: Thankfully, the partridges aren’t included.

ingredients.ingredient: Hangar One Spiced Pear Vodka (may substitute another pear vodka)

mix.how: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled coupe or Martini glass.
Garnish with a pear slice.

drinkName.name: Irish Buck
drinkName.about: A whiskey and ginger ale with a delicious citrus twist.

mix.how: Add the whiskey and lime juice to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top with the ginger ale and garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Cooperstown Cocktail
drinkName.about: Toast baseball’s legends with this minty concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake gently and strain into a cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Absolut Mango Spice
drinkName.about: Sweet has never tasted so hot.

mix.how: Add all of the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine-strain into a Martini glass or tumbler filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a jalapeño slice.

drinkName.name: Bacardí Cocktail
drinkName.about: After Prohibition, the Bacardí Cocktail became enormously popular, tempting unscrupulous barmen to serve it with whatever rum was on hand. Fortunately, the New York Supreme Court stepped in to protect cocktail fans by decreeing it could only be made with Bacardí rum.

mix.how: Pour all the ingredients into a shaker and stir.
Fill the shaker halfway with crushed ice, top with cubed ice, and shake vigorously until the shaker is frosted.
Fine-strain into a chilled Martini glass.

drinkName.name: Airmail Punch
drinkName.about: A teacup is the unusual vessel for this Champagne-topped rum drink.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (two parts honey, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled teacup filled with one large ice cube.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Hendrick’s Hot Gin Punch
drinkName.about: This fruity punch will keep a large group warm and happy.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a large saucepan and simmer over low heat for about 20 minutes.
To serve, pour the hot mixture into a punch bowl or teapot and garnish with orange slices studded with cloves.
Pair with gingerbread.

drinkName.name: Fruit and Gingerly
drinkName.about: A cocktail that certainly lives up to its name.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the cranberries and pineapple. Add the remaining ingredients except the club soda and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a pineapple chunk and/or three cranberries on a toothpick.

drinkName.name: Abuelita (The Grandmother)
drinkName.about: Respect your elders.

mix.how: Rinse a coupe glass with cinnamon liqueur and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with ground cinnamon.

drinkName.name: Between the Sheets
drinkName.about: Add a little rum to the Sidecar and you get this provocatively named classic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Flame an orange peel over the glass and discard before serving.

drinkName.name: Corzo Tequila Snow White
drinkName.about: The White Russian travels south of the border.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Greyhound’s Tooth
drinkName.about: Settle down PETA. It’s not what it sounds like.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a thick-cut grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Chile Fresca
drinkName.about: Red bell pepper is an unusual ingredient, but it works well in this sweet-and-spicy tequila cocktail.

mix.how: Combine equal parts of chile de arbol and salt on a saucer and use to coat the rim of a Collins glass.
Fill with ice and set aside.
In a shaker, muddle the cucumber, bell pepper and lemon juice.
Add the tequila, agave nectar and bitters, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Top with ginger beer and garnish with slices of cucumber and red bell pepper.

drinkName.name: Malice in Hollywood No. 1
drinkName.about: Remember the glamorous days of old Hollywood with this creation of ’40s gossip columnist Hedda Hopper.

mix.how: Add both the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass or tall shot glass.
Twist a swatch of thin-cut lemon peel over the top.

drinkName.name: Sidecar
drinkName.about: This is one ride you’ll gladly give up the wheel for.

ingredients.ingredient:
Cognac
Try it with Martell VS

mix.how: Coat the rim of a cocktail glass with sugar and set aside. (Do this a few minutes ahead of time so the sugar can dry and adhere well to the glass.).
Add the remaining ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a piece of orange peel.

drinkName.name: Raspberry White Chocolate Truffle
drinkName.about: Pure decadence in cocktail form.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with three raspberries on a pick.

drinkName.name: The Bottom Line
drinkName.about: It’s tasty, and you should try it.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice or a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Hellfire
drinkName.about: This spicy rum-and-beer concoctions is for sinners only.

mix.how: Squeeze the lime into a pint glass.
Fill with ice and add the rum, Tabasco and ginger beer.
Top with beer.

drinkName.name: Baileys Chai Swizzle
drinkName.about: Creamy and comforting, but exotically spiced.

mix.how: Brew a pot of chai tea.
Add 2 tsp of the brown sugar for every cup and stir until dissolved.
Add the Baileys and 3 oz of the tea to a mug and stir with the cinnamon stick.
(This drink can also be served cold: Simply chill the tea before mixing and serve in a tall glass filled with ice.).

drinkName.name: Beatnik
drinkName.about: Bongo drums, black beret and Jack Kerouac paperback not included.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange wheel.

drinkName.name: Sparkling Ginger Daisy
drinkName.about: The subtle spice of ginger heats up this gin-and-prosecco drink.

mix.how: If desired, coat the rim of a Champagne flute with the sugar and place the cherry in it.
Add all the other ingredients except the prosecco to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir until well chilled and strain into the prepared flute. Top with the prosecco.

drinkName.name: Grand Cosmo
drinkName.about: You have to mix one up to find out why it’s so grand.

mix.how: Combine all ingredients in a shaker.
Fill with ice, shake hard and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a thin lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Bobby Burns
drinkName.about: Practice your couplets and quatrains while sipping this cocktail named for the Scottish poet.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Twist a lemon peel over the glass to release its oils and then drop it into the drink.

drinkName.name: Fresh Watermelon Margarita
drinkName.about: No seed-spitting required.

ingredients.ingredient: Agave syrup (1 part agave nectar, 1 part water)

mix.how: Muddle the watermelon and agave syrup in a shaker.
Add the remaining ingredients and ice and shake.
Double-strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a watermelon slice.

drinkName.name: Moscow Mule
drinkName.about: This spicy vodka and ginger cocktail bites back. The Moscow Mule marries the clear spirit with ginger for a spicy kick. Lime adds a citrusy touch for a taste that will keep you coming back for more.

ingredients.ingredient:
Vodka
Try it with Absolut Elyx

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Turbinado
drinkName.about: How sweet it is.

ingredients.ingredient: Demerara syrup (one part Demerara sugar, one part water)

drinkName.name: Black Russian
drinkName.about: It takes a good drink to survive a Moscow winter. This recipe renders a fairly dry version of the drink. You can use more Kahlúa and less vodka to make a sweeter version.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir.
Strain into an Old Fashioned glass over fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Añejo Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: This tasty and simple recipe will never go out of style.

mix.how: In an Old Fashioned glass, lightly muddle the agave nectar, bitters and orange peel.
Fill with ice and add the tequila.
Stir, and garnish with a brandied cherry.

drinkName.name: Knob Creek Horse’s Neck (with a Kick)
drinkName.about: Extra-spicy ginger beer gives this old favorite new life.

ingredients.ingredient: Peel of a whole lemon (preferably in one piece)

mix.how: Add the bourbon, bitters and lemon peel to a highball glass and fill with ice.
Top with the ginger beer and jiggle the glass lightly to combine.

drinkName.name: Gin & Tonic
drinkName.about: The Gin & Tonic is the quintessential summer cocktail. The classic Gin & Tonic is both incredibly refreshing and easy to make.

mix.how: Add the gin to a highball glass and fill with fresh ice.
Top with tonic water.
Squeeze the lemon and lime wedges into the drink, drop into the glass and stir.

drinkName.name: Pink Flamingo
drinkName.about: Drink this tart and fizzy rum cooler to escape the heat.

mix.how: Add the rum and lime juice to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the grapefruit soda and garnish with a lime wheel or long lime twist.

drinkName.name: ’55 T-Bird
drinkName.about: With orange juice, orange zest and orange liqueur, the vitamin C in this drink will last you for weeks. Not that you’ll want to wait that long to have another.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe or a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Gin Rickey
drinkName.about: The Gin Rickey is delicious during the warmer months.

mix.how: Fill a highball glass with ice and add the gin.
Juice the lime halves into the glass, and drop in the juiced lime shells.
Fill with club soda.

drinkName.name: Wind At Your Back
drinkName.about: Looking for a taste of summer? Try Allen Katz’s ginger, rum and fresh juices cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a thin apple slice.

drinkName.name: Sloe Gin Fizz
drinkName.about: This old-timey recipe makes a delicious fruity classic.

ingredients.ingredient:
Sloe gin
Try it with Plymouth sloe gin

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a highball or Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the club soda.
Garnish with a lemon half-wheel and cherry.

drinkName.name: Paddington
drinkName.about: Named for the marmalade-loving bear, this drink gets a jolt of fruit flavor from orange preserves.

mix.how: Rinse a chilled coupe glass with absinthe.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Ginger Rogers
drinkName.about: If she was good enough for Fred Astaire, she’s good enough for you.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the strawberry and clementine.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an edible pansy.

drinkName.name: Kahlua Espresso Martini
drinkName.about: A potent mix of strong coffee and sweet liqueur.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Martini glass.

drinkName.name: Marguerite
drinkName.about: This old-school Martini goes heavy on the vermouth.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel and/or a small Spanish olive without pimento.

drinkName.name: Michael’s Word
drinkName.about: Mr. Collins promises you’ll love this drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a chilled coupe.
Garnish with a lime twist.

drinkName.name: Agave Ginger-Rita
drinkName.about: The spicy kick of ginger is a welcome addition to this update of the Margarita.

mix.how: If desired, coat the rim of a highball glass with salt, fill with ice and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Romanoff’s of Beverly Hills
drinkName.about: Drink like Bogie, Bacall and the Rat Pack: This was the house cocktail of their favorite Hollywood watering hole.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except ginger beer to a tall glass.
Fill halfway with cracked ice, drop in a juiced lime half, fill with ice and top with ginger beer.
This was the house cocktail of the Los Angeles restaurant where the Rat Pack was formed and Bogart and Bacall did their drinking.

drinkName.name: Last Word
drinkName.about: This complex, herbal cocktail will win any argument.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake.
Double-strain into a chilled coupe glass.

drinkName.name: Island Voodoo
drinkName.about: Shrunken head not included.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir well and strain into a chilled wine glass.
Garnish with a flamed orange peel.

drinkName.name: Bronx
drinkName.about: It’s not as famous as a Manhattan, but it’s just as tasty.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: The Valentino
drinkName.about: A tribute to the actor’s Italian birthplace, this variation on the Negroni is a modern classic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.This cocktail is on the menu at The Astor Room in Queens, New York.

drinkName.name: Elderflower Fizz
drinkName.about: Relax with this bubbly drink from Scottsdale, Ariz.’s Camelback Inn Resort & Spa.

ingredients.ingredient: lime sour (two parts organic lime juice, one part organic agave nectar)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the sparkling wine to a Champagne flute.
Top with sparkling wine.
Slap a thyme sprig once between your palms to release its oils.
Use it to stir the drink and leave it in as a garnish.

drinkName.name: Persephone’s Elixir
drinkName.about: Go tropical with this exotic tequila and pomegranate cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a highball glass.
Add a generous splash of ginger beer.

drinkName.name: Nicaraguan Negroni Punch
drinkName.about: Throw a party South American style.

mix.how: Add the lemon juice and cloves to a Tupperware container or cake mold and freeze until solid.
Add the remaining ingredients to a large punch bowl and add the lemon ice block.

drinkName.name: Pimm’s Cup
drinkName.about: The Pimm’s Cup is a classic British summertime drink that is filled with fruit.

ingredients.ingredient: Strawberry, hulled and cut into quarters

mix.how: To make a Pimm's cup, first add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice and stir to combine.
(To mix things up a bit, you can replace the Sprite, 7Up or ginger ale with Champagne.).

drinkName.name: Frenchie
drinkName.about: Combine gin, grapefruit juice and St-Germain and you’ll have the perfect refreshing cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a grapefruit half-wheel.

drinkName.name: The Ultimat Blueberry Freeze
drinkName.about: Cool down with this chilly concoction.

mix.how: Add all ingredients to a tall glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a watermelon slice.

drinkName.name: Juicy Basil
drinkName.about: This bourbon, orange and cranberry cocktail will get your juices flowing.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice and stir.
Garnish with an orange slice.

drinkName.name: Macuá
drinkName.about: Named for a Central American bird, this fruity, tropical sipper was named the national drink of Nicaragua.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well for 20 to 30 seconds.
Strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange slice and a candied cherry.

drinkName.name: Blue Tahoe
drinkName.about: The shocking color belies a classy Champagne-and-tequila concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a Collins glass and fill with ice.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with an orange slice, mint leaf and cherry.

drinkName.name: Honey Deuce
drinkName.about: Raspberry, lemonade, vodka: the ultimate summer trifecta.

mix.how: Fill a chilled highball glass with crushed ice and add the vodka.
Top with lemonade to just below the rim and then add the Chambord.
Garnish with honeydew melon balls.

drinkName.name: Stars and Stripes
drinkName.about: A refreshing and fruity patriotic cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: G.E. Massenez Framboise Sauvage Raspberry Brandy

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the blueberries.
Add the vodka, absinthe, syrup and lemon juice, and fill with ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into a highball glass. Drizzle with brandy and top with ginger beer.
Garnish with one sugar cube.

drinkName.name: Piñata
drinkName.about: Take a swing at this pineapple-juice-and-aged-tequila combo.

mix.how: Add the tequila to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Fill with pineapple juice and garnish with a pineapple wedge.

drinkName.name: My Thai
drinkName.about: This rum cocktail combines spicy Thai chiles and cooling coconut milk.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the Thai chile pepper and Grand Marnier.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a tiki mug filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a pineapple leaf and another Thai chile pepper.

drinkName.name: Moroccopolitan
drinkName.about: A few drops of spicy bitters heat up this sweet pomegranate cocktail.

mix.how: Add the bitters to a chilled cocktail glass and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Enc(rust)ed Nail
drinkName.about: The classic Rusty Nail gets an update.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a Champagne flute.

drinkName.name: Traditional Elderfashion
drinkName.about: This St-Germain and bourbon drink will always be trendy.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to an Old Fashioned glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: Cruzan Flip
drinkName.about: With rum, cream and egg, this drink is the perfect nightcap.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a cocktail glass or 5-ounce juice glass.
Garnish with a light dusting of freshly grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Tequila Furnace
drinkName.about: Fire up a traditional tequila shot with a little hot sauce.

mix.how: Pour the tequila into a tall shot glass.
Add a few drops of Tabasco Sauce and stir gently.
Lick some salt off your hand, drink the tequila and then bite the lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Manuka Mule
drinkName.about: Ginger ale is the perfect partner for a honey-flavored vodka.

mix.how: Squeeze the lime wedges into a highball glass and add the mint sprig.
Muddle gently and fill with ice.
Add the vodka and top with ginger beer or ginger ale.
Garnish with a cucumber slice.

drinkName.name: Pierre Ferrand Ambre
drinkName.about: Try this cognac cocktail flavored with citrus, cucumber and ginger; it’s as sophisticated as it sounds.

mix.how: Place the lime peel and ginger slices in a short tumbler.
Add half of the cognac.
Lightly press the lime and ginger 2 or 3 times using a muddler or the back of a spoon.
Fill the glass halfway with ice.
Stir for 5 seconds.
Add the remaining cognac, club soda and cucumber peel.
Stir for another 5 seconds.

drinkName.name: Green Acres Punch
drinkName.about: Rum cocktails are the life for me

ingredients.ingredient: Demerara simple syrup (two parts Demerara sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl or other container, cover and let stand overnight.
Strain, and refrigerate until cold.
Pour into a wine glass and garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Beach Bum
drinkName.about: Feel like you’re on permanent vacation with this refreshing vodka cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the grenadine into a shaker with ice and shake.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Top with the grenadine.
Garnish with fresh mint.

drinkName.name: The Bow Tie
drinkName.about: No need to get dressed up to enjoy this cognac cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled rocks glass.
Garnish with a pineapple leaf.

drinkName.name: Jockey Club
drinkName.about: Mix up this distant cousin of the Manhattan.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a brandied cherry on a cocktail pick.

drinkName.name: Pyrat Passion
drinkName.about: This drink will make you passionate about rum.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a bucket glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a peach wedge if desired.

drinkName.name: Sea Breeze
drinkName.about: This light, refreshing drink is just the thing for a day at the beach.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a highball glass with ice and stir.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Golden Cup
drinkName.about: Take first place with this Beefeater 24 Gin drink.

mix.how: In a mixing glass, bruise the apple and cucumber.
Add the gin, curaçao and sherry, and fill with ice.
Stir, and pour (unstrained) into a pilsner, wine or Collins glass.
Top with club soda and garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Desmo
drinkName.about: The deep, caramel sweetness of a good balsamic vinegar matches beautifully with aged cognac.

mix.how: Add both ingredients to a brandy snifter or coupe and swirl to combine.
If desired, garnish with a flamed orange peel.

drinkName.name: Fuzzy Navel
drinkName.about: Put on your Members Only jacket and mix up this ’80s classic.

mix.how: Add both ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice.
(To make a Hairy Navel, substitute vodka for half the peach schnapps.).

drinkName.name: Black Hawk
drinkName.about: The gin may be sloe but you’ll drink this cocktail quickly.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with cracked ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a cherry and half an orange slice.

drinkName.name: Chairman’s Refresher
drinkName.about: Cooling cucumber and thirst-quenching coconut water contribute to this rum concoction.

mix.how: In a mixing glass, muddle the Frangelico and cucumber.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Stir, and fine strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a cucumber slice.

drinkName.name: Strawberries and Cream
drinkName.about: The perfect summer cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a strawberry.

drinkName.name: Vanilla Skye
drinkName.about: Chocolate, mint and a big, peaty Scotch flavor this drink. Trust us, it works.

ingredients.ingredient: White crème de menthe (the cheaper the better)
Chocolate bitters (Scrappy's, The Bitter Truth or Fee Brothers)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled coupette glass. Twist a piece of lemon peel over the drink to extract the oils and discard. This drink is one of Gary Regan's 101 Best New Cocktails.
